title: Minor wording issue in the spec
body:
by **frithiof.schulze**: 
The section about composite literals contains the rules

  A literal that does not contain any keys must list an
  element for each struct field in the order in which the
  fields are declared.

and

  A literal may omit the element list; such a literal
  evaluates to the zero value for its type.

I think formally these rules contradict each other, even
though it is clear what is meant. The first rule should
maybe read

  An element list that does not contain any keys must list
  an element for each struct field in the order	in which the
  fields are declared.

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')

go version devel +fc8137c00f9c Sat Oct 13 19:05:22 2012 +0800
